div.p: RB MSS M108b, Library, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne.

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p: MS annotations by M: 'N.11 Leveillea Schimperi Decaisne N.82 Halophila ovalis' and 'Answ. 6/10/88'. Letter not found. Central Schools

p.style: font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;
font-family: Geneva, Geneva; font-size: 12pt; text-align: end;

div.p: I have the honor to forward you, at the request of Mr F. Kilner of this town, a packet of Sea weed collected by me during the past few months from our coast and from the Burnett river — As it is my first essay at Collecting in this branch of Botany, I trust you will kindly overlook any defects in the way of preserving the specimens. I fear also that I have more than once given the same plant under a different number — but I thought it best to keep separate any forms that appear to differ in shape, color, or habitat, even when I felt pretty certain the difference in shape and color was due to the different degree of maturity of the plant.

I do most earnestly hope that you may find something of interest among them. Certainly, the collecting of them has afforded me many an agreeable hour.
See also M to J. Agardh, 5 October 1888, and J. Agardh to M, undated (in this edition as 88-11-00). For Agardh's identifications of Keys's specimens, see J. Agardh to M, undated (in this edition as 89-00-00b).
